items.title: Essay: Rupee origins and Sher Shah Suri
notes: Hindi write-up on ‘Rupaya’, Sher Shah Suri’s reforms, weights (tola ≈ 11.66 g), and administrative notes.

items.title: Formulae for changing eras (AD/AH/VS/SS)
notes: Quick conversions: AD ↔ AH, Vikram Samvat (VS), Saka Samvat (SS).

items.title: Sultan of Delhi — Gold Coins (Tughlaq Dynasty)
notes: Ghiyath al-Din Tughluq (c. 1320–1325 CE) gold tanka; weight ~11 g.
Muhammad bin Tughluq issues also shown (c. 1325–1351 CE).
Board remark about widespread fakes during the period.

items.title: Sultan of Delhi — Gold Coins (Tughlaq Dynasty), set 2
notes: Additional specimens for Ghiyath al-Din and Muhammad bin Tughluq; gold tanka ~11 g.
Repeat note on counterfeits/fakes indicated on the board.

items.title: Bengal Sultanate & Ahmadnagar — mixed silver/copper sheet
notes: Flips labeled for Bengal Sultans incl. Ala al-Din Husain, Nasir al-Din etc.
Ahmadnagar coins (various rulers) also present on the same sheet.

items.title: Bahmani Sultanate (Deccan) — assorted copper/silver
notes: Labels include Shihab al-Din Ahmad, Ala al-Din Ahmad, Mahmud Shah, Kalim Allah Shah, Nizamuddin Ahmad (various dates).

items.title: Bahmani (top row) & Delhi Sultanate — Tughlaq issues
notes: Top: Bahmani specimens (incl. Muhammad Shah, Taj al-Din Shah, etc.).
Bottom: Delhi Tughlaq pieces (Ghiyath al-Din Tughluq, Muhammad bin Tughluq).

items.title: Delhi Sultanate — Tughlaq & Khalji rulers (mixed)
notes: Firoz Shah Tughluq (r. 1351–1388 CE) types; also entries for Gayasuddin Tughlaq.
Khalji issues: Alauddin Khalji (r. 1296–1316 CE), Qutb al-Din Mubarak etc.

items.title: Early Delhi Sultanate — Mamluk/Slave & Khalji
notes: Iltutmish (Shams al-Din) noted; Balban series; Qutb al-Din Mubarak.
Lower rows: Turk/early issues incl. Muhammad bin Sam (Ghorid) legends on some flips.

items.title: Delhi Sultanate — Turk/Mamluk large-flan issues
notes: Large-flan silver types labeled for Nasiruddin Mahmud, Alauddin Masud, Muizzuddin (Aybak) etc.

items.title: Delhi Sultanate (Suri Dynasty) — Sher Shah Suri issues
notes: Multiple flips marked ‘Sher Shah Suri’, including square-field silver tankas with camp mint references on some flips.
